conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container (D or E) it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A, which is located at the top left.
The liquid from A will move downward and to the right, passing through the black and brown baffles.
The liquid from A will continue to flow towards the bottom left corner, where container D is located.
Liquid flows from B, which is located at the top center.
The liquid from B will move downward, passing through the cyan baffle.
The liquid from B will continue to flow towards the bottom center, where container E is located.
Liquid flows from C, which is located at the top right.
The liquid from C will move downward and to the left, passing through the purple and white baffles.
The liquid from C will continue to flow towards the bottom right corner, where container E is located.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from A.
Container E will receive liquid from B and C.
